Title: Israeli ministers blindsided by hostage footage at October 7 memo...
Description: Israel's Channel 12 reported that cabinet ministers were shocked and embarrassed when confronted with a video of hostages pleading with them directly

Title: Israeli company to fire Bedouin assaulted by deputy mayor
Description: Dor Alon Energy accuses the worker of giving the police security footage of the assault without its approval, while the employee says the company refused to give him the recording

Title: Israel at war, day 368: Hezbollah says it backs cease-fire in Leb...
Description: IDF says fourth division has joined ground offensive in Lebanon ■ U.S. is reportedly not pursuing efforts for cease-fire along Israel-Lebanon border at this moment ■ CIA chief Bill Burns: Israel 'weighing very carefully' how to respond to Iran's ballistic missile attack last week ■ WHO official warns of 'higher risk of disease outbreaks' in Lebanon ■ what you need to know 368 days into the war

Title: A Tel Aviv rooftop garden tells the survival stories of Israel's ...
Description: The project by the Asif Culinary Institute invited farmers from Israel's north and south to plant crops meaningful to them on a rooftop plot in Tel Aviv – to tell their stories and help plant new roots

Title: Arab Israeli arrested for social media post allegedly celebrating...
Description: Police arrested Intisar Hijazi, 41, and photographed her blindfolded and handcuffed under an Israeli flag for a social media post they claim was 'disturbing public peace.' She was arrested after National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir complained about the post

Title: After October 7, just how far right will Israel go?
Description: October 7 should have handed Israel's wild-eyed right the perfect storm for success: wartime rallying and vengeful fury. So why don't the polls over the past year back that up?

Title: An iconic Jerusalem village, magnet for pilgrims, faces a towerin...
Description: Ein Karem, a unique pastoral village in the Israeli capital, draws tourists from all over the world. Now, it's in danger of losing its charm due to a planned real estate project. 'There is incredible greed here,' says a resident who is fighting the construction plan

Title: Trump attends two October 7 memorial events in NY and Miami, meet...
Description: Trump offered to sign a Jewish prayer book given to him by a rabbi at one event. The former president also suggested that Gaza's beachfront property could offer economic benefits and praised Israel's 'amazing' warfare, and said Israel needs to 'get smart about Trump'

Title: For a mother, when her child is a hostage, he's a hostage. It do...
Description: For me, he is alive,' says Yael Adar, mother of hostage Tamir Adar, who the IDF announced was killed in captivity. 'Cognitively, I know he's not, but emotionally I allow myself the illusion that maybe there was a mistake, that maybe he will be found injured, that he'll return'

Title: West Bank's Palestinians fear Israeli army and settlers will stop...
Description: The current olive harvest season is especially important for the Palestinians given the economic hardship caused by the war. Settlers have already used violence against harvesters, and many fear that the army won't provide adequate protection and will prevent them from accessing their lands

Description: Despite the IDF's successes in Gaza and southern Lebanon, the failure and abiding threat of October 7 will continue to hang over Israel. So will the war, which is liable to go on for years

Title: Almost half of Jewish Israelis, nearly all Arab citizens think th...
Description: A slim majority of Israelis believe the time has come to end the war in Gaza, according to a survey by the Israel Democracy Institute. Israeli Jews and Arabs agree that the war's main goal should be bringing back the hostages, not toppling Hamas. 45 percent of Israelis said that they are optimistic about Israel going forward

Title: Almost half the Jews, nearly all Arabs think the Gaza war must st...
Description: Most Israelis, Jewish and Arab alike, agree the war's main goal is to regain the hostages but the Jews are significantly more upbeat about the future

Title: We are dying of fear': A lost generation, Israeli and Palestinia...
Description: It's my little children who pay the price of these wars': The father of seven-year-old Amina al-Hassouni, the sole Israeli casualty of Iran's April missile strike and still hospitalized in Tel Aviv, expresses the pain and fatigue of parents across Israel and Gaza. But there's also a glimmer of hope

Title: In the year since October 7, Israel saw worst environmental damag...
Description: 340,000 dunams have been set afire across Israel and the West Bank. However, the most harm is actually caused by constant army operations

Title: 340,000 dunams have been set afire, causing worst damage in 60 ye...
Description: Israel Nature and Parks Authority says 196,000 dunams of total are in the north, with the Nahal Yehudia sustaining the worst damage. However, the most harm is actually caused by constant army operations

Title: Israelis gather in Hostage Square on eve of Oct. 7 to share stori...
Description: Hundreds of people gathered in Hostage Square in Tel Aviv to begin commemorations marking one year since October 7. Families of hostages shared their stories of that day, and those of their loved ones

Title: He believed it was possible to live a life that isn't just a war...
Description: Sharone Lifschitz's mother Yocheved returned from Hamas captivity, while her 84-year-old father remains in Gaza. But she is equally committed to bringing other hostages back: 'My fight isn't only over my dad, but equally for Sasha and Arbel and Itzik and Ofer'

Title: My family barely survived October 7. I can't believe my friends a...
Description: One year after October 7, Israel still lacks a strategy to achieve two of the war's main goals: replacing Hamas' rule in Gaza with a more favorable entity that Israel can live next to, and bringing back our hostages alive. Time isn't on our side

Title: Here's how Jews around the world will be marking the one-year ann...

Title: The hostage families and survivors are outcasts because we remin...
Description: Merav Svirsky, whose brother Itay was killed while in Hamas captivity, is fighting to bring him and other hostages home. Though she believes the government sees the hostages' families as a nuisance, she insists the they will not be cast out: 'This fight is about remaining moral and ethical'

Title: Behind every hostage is an entire life. We need to talk about th...
Description: On October 7, Alon Ohel was abducted from what later came to be known as the 'death shelter' together with Hersh Goldberg-Polin, Elia Cohen, and Or Levy. Title: The hostages are buried alive, and there's no solidarity. Mutual...
Description: A year after his son Tal Shoham was kidnapped to the Gaza Strip, Gilad Korngold is disappointed with the government – but also with the Israeli public. 'I wonder what kind of country we live in, when shortly before the anniversary of the kidnappings people will go on vacation and celebrate Rosh Hashanah,' he says. 'In my dreams, I would expect a revolt, but I know it won't happen'

Title: Six killed, 10 wounded in shooting attack in Jaffa, Israel Police...
Description: Two assailants opened fire toward a light rail station on Jaffa's Jerusalem Boulevard, and were shot dead. Police and army forces are searching the area for further threats. Five of those wounded are in serious condition

Title: EU aviation agency's warning against flying over Israel and Leban...
Description: 26 major carriers have suspended flights to Israel, as the European agency cites significant risks of misidentification and miscalculation amid missile threats and air defense activation

Title: Daughter of Israeli-American hostage Keith Siegel begs the public...
Description: Ilan Siegel initially believed her father would be freed soon after his abduction from Kibbutz Kfar Azza on October 7. Now, she feels that time is eroding hope: 'In the first months, there was hope that the army and the government would want to make amends as quickly as possible, but it feels like we're only deteriorating.'

Title: Without Hezbollah, Lebanon's economy could rise out of the ashes
Description: It's a long shot, but even amid financial crisis, dysfunctional government and brain drain, Lebanon has many of the raw materials to start over

Title: Hamas and Hezbollah trapped Israel on October 7. Now Israel is tr...
Description: Tehran and Washington are facing tremendous dilemmas, trapped between two highly fraught options. Their choices will determine the fate of the Middle East for both the short term and for years to come

Title: Gideon Sa'ar's joining Netanyahu's government: Petty deception th...
Description: By crawling into the Netanyahu cabinet from the opposition, Gideon Sa'ar, the head of the United Right opposition faction, becomes the government's protective shield and perhaps also might head off the convening of a national commission of inquiry over Oct. 7

Title: Western nations warn Iran: Intervention in Lebanon could trigger ...
Description: Diplomats caution Tehran that an attack on Israel may provoke strikes on strategic sites, including nuclear and oil facilities, amid escalating tensions with Hezbollah near the Lebanese border

Title: U.S. accuses Iran of hacking former ambassador to Israel and Stat...
Description: The unsealed indictment details a cyber-influence operation by Iran's Revolutionary Guards in which three Iranians broke into email accounts of diplomats, espionage agency officials and officials from the Trump campaign. This operation is part of a larger effort to expose Iranian election interference

Title: Israeli army launches 'limited' ground incursion against Hezbolla...
Description: According to the IDF, the operation targets Lebanese villages near the border that pose a threat to northern Israeli communities, with the aim of enabling displaced residents to return home. Title: Newly sworn-in Gideon Sa'ar in Knesset: Nobody in opposition trie...
Description: In response to charges that he broke promises not to join Netanyahu, Sa'ar said that since October 7 he has decided to 'to set aside the wars between the Jews and focus on the war against our enemies.' In his speech to the Knesset, he accused opposition members who attacked his decision of 'smears, libels and lies' and of having no impact on the country since the war's start

Title: Banned Columbia student who said 'Zionists don't deserve to live'...
Description: A suspension letter from the university cited an incident in which the student organized a human chain to block Zionist students from accessing the campus lawn. According to him, he was denied due process and fair treatment, and was targeted because he is Black and pro-Palestinian

Title: Israel's Education Ministry advised schools to celebrate Nasralla...
Description: The Ministry's Religious Education Administration suggested that schools organize celebrations, such as dancing or distributing food, to mark the death of the Hezbollah leader in an Israeli airstrike. While some schools followed the recommendation, it drew criticism from certain officials

Title: Israel set to enter new phase of Lebanon fighting, meaning close ...
Description: Israel is preparing for a ground incursion into southern Lebanon, an operation that will initially focus on Hezbollah military infrastructure near the border

Title: For Netanyahu's government, the endgame of war is war
Description: Between us and Jordan lies the reality Israel fights to ignore: millions of Palestinians with nowhere to go, waiting – like many Israelis I know – to live in peace. Yet, Israel's refusal to recognize a Palestinian partner and pursue a solution persists, despite Arab neighbors willing to help it get there

Title: Israel at war, day 360: IDF says it killed leaders of Hamas, PFLP...
Description: Israel reportedly conducting raids in southern Lebanon, planning limited but imminent ground op ■ Lebanon's caretaker PM Najib Mikati says his government is ready to send Lebanese army to south to ensure it is demilitarized ■ Shin Bet says it thwarted attempts by Iran to assassinate senior Israeli officials inside Israel ■ Here's what you need to know 360 days into the war

Title: He already lost one brother in Gaza's tunnels, now he's fighting ...
Description: Sharon Sharabi, whose brother Yossi was killed in Hamas captivity and whose other brother Eli remains a hostage, recently accompanied Prime Minister Netanyahu to the UN. 'He shook my hand, and I said to him: 'Think of this hand as the hand of a hostage reaching out to you for an entire year from Hamas tunnels, saying: I trust you, save me.''

Title: Report: Israel tracked Nasrallah with unknown substance before de...
Description: Saudi news channel Al Hadath reported that an unidentified man traveling from Iran to Beirut met with Nasrallah with the express purpose of shaking his hand in order to transfer a trackable substance onto the leader's palm

Title: Israel's High Court upholds decision to hold security prisoner's ...
Description: The judges dismissed the petition of the family of Walid Daqqa, ruling that the state's decision to withhold his body for use in hostage negotiations with Hamas was reasonable. Daqqa, a Palestinian with Israeli citizenship, died of cancer this year while in prison after fully serving his for his role in the murder of an Israeli soldier in 1987

Title: The young asylum seekers wishing to join the Israeli army, in exc...
Description: They were born and raised in Israel, but have no legal status. The children of Eritrean asylum seekers want nothing more than to be drafted. Now, a controversial plan being advanced by the state may take them up on it

Title: Israel on high alert for Oct. 7 and holiday period; issues warnin...
Description: Israeli security forces are expected to be on high alert after IDF and Shin Bet raised the possibility that Hamas leaders could encourage Gazans to march en masse toward the border with Israel on the one-year anniversary of October 7

Title: Netanyahu's ex-rival gifts him an even stronger grip on power - u...
Description: Without having to sacrifice one seat in the Knesset, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is now getting four more right-wing votes. It's a total victory over Gideon Sa'ar, the politician who was once one of his greatest rivals but is now the last link in the government food chain

Title: Israel targets Hezbollah chief Nasrallah in massive Beirut strike...
Description: Israel estimates that Nasrallah was at the Hezbollah headquarters, the site of the strike, during the attack, and two other senior Hezbollah commanders were killed. According to initial estimates from Israeli defense officials, some 300 people were killed in the strike
